H0.text: Which early aviator flew in a plane christened Jason. Charles Lindbergh

H1.text: Which early aviator flew in a plane christened Jason. Amelia Earhart

H2.text: Which early aviator flew in a plane christened Jason. Jean Batten

H3.text: Which early aviator flew in a plane christened Jason. Amy Johnson

A4.text: Flying Jason, she left Croydon Airport, Surrey, on 5 May and landed at Darwin, Northern Territory on 24 May, a distance of 11,000 miles (18,000 km).

A5.text: She bought a secondhand de Havilland DH.60 Gipsy Moth G-AAAH and named it Jason after her father's business trade mark.
